source.28072ba6:
#Plotting the heatmap

ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(50,20))
corr = new_data_2.corr() #ploting the heatmap
sns.heatmap(corr, xticklabels=corr.columns, yticklabels=corr.columns, annot=True, cmap=sns.diverging_palette(220, 20, as_cmap=True))
source.8511662d:
#1. Having a look at countries within Latin America & Caribbean region

LAC=new_data_2.groupby('Region').get_group('Latin America & Caribbean')
LAC.head(3)
source.5567f1be:
#Country wise trend of women in workforce in Latin America & Caribbean region

plt.figure(figsize=(25,8))
plt.plot(LAC.loc[:,"Country Name"],LAC.loc[:,"1990"],color='red',label='Year: 1990')
plt.plot(LAC.loc[:,"Country Name"],LAC.loc[:,"2010"],color='green',label='Year: 2010')
plt.plot(LAC.loc[:,"Country Name"],LAC.loc[:,"2019"],color='blue',label='Year: 2019') 
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.grid(linewidth=0.4)
plt.title("Percentage of women in workforce vs Latin America & Caribbean countries for the year")
plt.xlabel("Latin America and Caribbean Countries")
plt.ylabel("Percentage of Women in workforce")


plt.legend()

source.cc5f81b6:
import plotly.express as px
# import matplotlib
# import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
# import seaborn as sns
source.fc955396:
#Choropleth map of the world. To ccheck for other years between 1990 to 2019, replace the year in color='xxxx'
figure=px.choropleth(new_data_2,locations='Country Name',locationmode='country names',color='1990',animation_frame='IncomeGroup')
figure.update_layout(title='Percentage of women in workforce in 1990')
figure.show()

figure=px.choropleth(new_data_2,locations='Country Name',locationmode='country names',color='2019',animation_frame='IncomeGroup')
figure.update_layout(title='Percentage of women in workforce in 2019')
figure.show()

#### Computing the correlation matrix and Heatmap: 
-Correlation is a term used to represent the statistical measure of linear relationship between two variables. It can also be defined as the measure of dependence between two different variables.
